ranges.notes: New Year's Day (Jan 1) is a public holiday. Most businesses, shops, and restaurants are closed or operate with limited hours. Cologne is quiet as residents recover from New Year's Eve celebrations.

Epiphany (Jan 6) marks the official end of the Christmas season. While not a public holiday in North Rhine-Westphalia (the state where Cologne is located), many Christmas decorations remain up until this date, and special services are held at Cologne Cathedral and other churches.

Off-season with few tourists and excellent hotel value. Cold winter weather with temperatures often hovering just above freezing. Limited daylight hours (around 8-9 hours). Winter sales begin mid-January in all shops. Many museums offer special winter exhibitions. Indoor activities are popular at this time. Early preparations for Carnival may be visible.

Winter continues with cold weather but slightly longer days than January. Cologne's low tourism season continues, making it a good time for museum visits and indoor cultural activities without crowds. Many cafés and brewhouses offer cozy winter menus and atmosphere.

Cologne's famous Carnival season reaches its peak with major celebrations beginning on Weiberfastnacht (Women's Carnival Day) through Rose Monday (Rosenmontag) parade and ending on Ash Wednesday. During this period, Cologne transforms with elaborate costumes, street parties, and traditional events throughout the city. Tourism increases significantly during this period and accommodation should be booked well in advance.

Early spring brings gradually warming temperatures and longer days. The city recovers from Carnival celebrations and returns to normal rhythm. Trees begin to bud and early spring flowers appear in Cologne's parks and along the Rhine. City life begins to move outdoors as café terraces start to open when weather permits.

Spring officially begins, bringing longer days and warmer temperatures. Flora and Botanical Garden and Rheinpark start showing colorful blooms. Outdoor activities become more popular along the Rhine promenades. Tourism gradually increases but still before peak season.

Spring is in full swing with blossoming trees and flowers throughout the city, particularly in the Flora and Botanical Garden. The weather can be variable with rain showers alternating with sunny days. Easter markets and celebrations may be present in early April depending on when Easter falls.

Cologne's historic cable car (Kölner Seilbahn) typically reopens for the season in mid-April, offering spectacular views across the Rhine River. Cherry blossoms typically peak in the Altstadt and nearby Bonn (famous for its cherry blossom tunnels). Outdoor cafés and biergartens become fully operational along the Rhine.

Labor Day (May 1) is a public holiday in Germany with public demonstrations, rallies, and events throughout Cologne. Many businesses are closed. Outdoor festivities and political events take place throughout the city.

The Cologne Spring Festival typically takes place in May at the Deutzer Werft with fairground rides, beer tents, and traditional entertainment. Perfect spring weather with comfortable temperatures makes this an ideal time to visit before summer crowds arrive. The Rhine promenades become lively with locals and visitors enjoying the riverfront.

Early summer brings warm days and pleasant evenings as Cologne begins preparations for its famous Pride celebrations. The city's LGBTQ+ community hosts preliminary events throughout June. Tourism increases as the outdoor season is in full swing. Outdoor dining, beer gardens, and evening activities along the Rhine become particularly popular.

Cologne Pride, one of Europe's largest Pride events, typically takes place in early July, culminating with the Christopher Street Day parade. The city becomes extremely busy with visitors from around the world, and the streets fill with rainbow decorations, parties, and cultural events.

The hottest month of the year with temperatures occasionally exceeding 30°C. Peak summer season with high tourism levels and occasional summer thunderstorms. Rhine beaches and riverside events are in full swing. Summer festivals and cultural events throughout the city. Kölner Lichter (Cologne Lights) fireworks festival typically takes place in late July, lighting up the Rhine with music and pyrotechnics.

Summer festivities continue throughout August with cultural events, outdoor concerts, and activities along the Rhine. The summer heat continues with warm days and comfortable evenings. Rhine in Flammen (Rhine in Flames) events may take place, featuring illuminated ship parades and fireworks. Cologne's museums offer special summer exhibitions, and outdoor film screenings are popular throughout the city.

September brings Cologne Wine Week, celebrating regional and international wines with tastings and food pairings in various locations throughout the city. Excellent time to visit as summer crowds begin to diminish while weather remains warm during the day but more comfortable, especially in the evenings. Local life returns to normal rhythm after summer holidays. The Rhine promenades remain lively with pleasant temperatures.
Wine-related events continue into early October with harvest celebrations and tastings.

German Unity Day (Tag der Deutschen Einheit) is a nationwide public holiday commemorating German reunification in 1990. Government offices and most businesses are closed. Public celebrations and events take place throughout Cologne, particularly around the Cathedral and Alter Markt.

Pleasant autumn weather with gradually cooling temperatures. Trees begin to display fall colors in Cologne's parks and along the Rhine. Ideal conditions for urban exploration and day trips to nearby regions like the Siebengebirge mountains. Hallowe'en celebrations grow increasingly popular in Cologne, with themed events at clubs and bars in the last week of October. Autumn beer specialties appear in traditional brewhouses.

All Saints' Day is a public holiday in North Rhine-Westphalia. Many businesses and shops are closed as locals visit cemeteries to honor deceased family members. Weather turns noticeably cooler with occasional rain and first frosts possible.

Full autumn with cooler temperatures and shorter days. Tourism levels decrease significantly. Good time for museum visits and indoor cultural activities. Many restaurants offer seasonal autumn specialties featuring game, mushrooms, and pumpkin dishes.

St. Martin's Day (Martinstag) celebrations include children's lantern processions through the streets of Cologne, particularly in residential neighborhoods. Traditional goose dinners are served at many restaurants.
Mid-November sees cooling temperatures and occasionally foggy days along the Rhine. Museum visits and indoor cultural activities become more popular.

Late November sees the city preparing for the Christmas season. Christmas decorations appear throughout the city center, and Cologne's famous Christmas Markets typically open during the last week of November, transforming the city with holiday lights and decorations.

Cologne's Christmas Markets run from late November until December 22 or 23. The city hosts seven distinct Christmas markets, with the most famous at the Cathedral square (Dom), Alter Markt (Old Town), Neumarkt, and the Harbor Christmas Market at the Chocolate Museum. Each market has its own theme and character, creating a festive atmosphere throughout the city with illuminated streets, traditional wooden stalls, regional crafts, and seasonal foods.

Christmas Eve (Heiligabend) is the main celebration day for most German families. Many businesses close early on December 24. The Christmas Markets are typically closed by this date. Cologne Cathedral holds special Christmas Eve services that attract many visitors.

December 25 and 26 are both public holidays in Germany. Most businesses, restaurants, and attractions are closed or operate with limited hours. A quiet time in the city as most residents celebrate with family.
The period between Christmas and New Year sees the city in a quiet mode. Many locals are on holiday, but most major attractions reopen. Good time for winter sales shopping and museum visits.

New Year's Eve (Silvester) celebrations take place throughout Cologne, particularly around the Cathedral, Alter Markt, and along the Rhine River. Many restaurants offer special dinner menus, and hotels host celebration events. Fireworks displays light up the skyline at midnight, with the Cathedral and Rhine bridges creating a spectacular backdrop.

scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism (or cold winter days)
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very low/high tourism (business closures)
scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or very limited activities
